content.description: <math alttext="The figure presents a 2 row table with 4 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x,” and the heading for row 2 is “g of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. x is 0. g of x is 5. Column 2. x is 1. g of x is 4. Column 3. x is 2. g of x is 1. Column 4. x is 3. g of x is negative 2." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em 3em" equalrows="true" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0.5ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="1ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></math>
content.question: Selected values of the twice-differentiable function <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are given in the table above. What is the value of <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 3, of, g prime of x, times, the cosine squared, of, open parenthesis, 2 times g of x, plus 1, close parenthesis, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mrow><mi>cos</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
